slides.text: Morning sun over Whisker City. The smell of coffee, pancakes... and trouble.
At Kitten’s Diner, Cherry the kwotton waitress ties her apron tight.
She’s got charm, claws, and zero tolerance for rude customers.
The breakfast rush begins.
The Coffee Critic sneered, ‘Too bitter, like your attitude.’
Cherry gritted her teeth. One more refill — one more shot at victory.
With a single flip of her tail, Cherry silenced the Coffee Critic.
‘Extra cream, less attitude,’ she purred.
But lunch was coming — and so was The Noodle Bandit.
The Noodle Bandit slurped the entire pot before Cherry could react.
Cherry narrowed her eyes. Nobody out-slurps a kwotton twice.
The Noodle Bandit was left tangled in his own spaghetti.
Cherry flicked a stray noodle from her sleeve and sighed.
Dinner shift loomed... and with it, her final challenge — The Food Critic Queen.
The Food Critic Queen dabbed her lips. ‘Mediocre. Like your service.’
Cherry’s ears twitched. She was not losing the dinner crowd.
The Queen’s plate was empty. Silence filled the diner.
Then — a slow clap. ‘Purr-fection,’ she whispered.
Cherry smiled, tail swaying. Another shift survived.
Outside, the neon sign hummed softly: Kitten’s Diner — Always Open.
